programme.title: Love in the Time of Cholera
programme.desc: A man (Javier Bardem) loses the woman he loves to a wealthier suitor and waits 50 years for the day he finally can win her back.

programme.title: Flashdance
programme.desc: A Pittsburgh welder (Jennifer Beals) dances nights in a bar, dates her boss (Michael Nouri) and dreams of going to ballet school.

programme.title: Hannah and Her Sisters
programme.desc: Hannah's (Mia Farrow) husband (Michael Caine) has an affair with one sister, and her ex-husband (Woody Allen) marries the other.

programme.title: Small Soldiers
programme.desc: A boy (Gregory Smith) and his neighborhood crush (Kirsten Dunst) become involved in a war when a faulty microchip turns toy soldiers into a tiny but lethal army.

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friend's widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singer's debut album.

programme.title: Semi-Pro
programme.desc: In 1976 a singer (Will Ferrell) uses the profits from his only hit to buy a basketball team that is in danger of going under when the ABA and the NBA merge.

programme.title: Cedar Rapids
programme.desc: Three veteran attendees guide a sheltered insurance agent (Ed Helms) through a life-altering weekend at an Iowa convention.

programme.title: Mississippi Grind
programme.desc: Convinced that his newfound friend (Ryan Reynolds) is a good-luck charm, a gambling addict (Ben Mendelsohn) takes the man on a road trip to a high-stakes poker game in New Orleans.

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: A teen (Olivia DeJonge) and her younger brother (Ed Oxenbould) discover a shocking secret about their seemingly charming grandparents while staying at their remote Pennsylvania farm.

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: After meeting the gal (Mary Elizabeth Winstead) of his dreams, a charming slacker (Michael Cera) must contend with an army of her ex-boyfriends, wanting to get rid of him.

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A mysterious operative (Zoe Saldana) joins forces with a group of elite commandos (Jeffrey Dean Morgan, Chris Evans), as they hunt the man who organized a lethal betrayal against them.

programme.title: The Box
programme.desc: A husband (James Marsden) and wife (Cameron Diaz) receive a simple wooden box which will grant them $1 million, but simultaneously, it will cause the death of someone elsewhere in the world.

programme.title: The Witch
programme.desc: In 1630 New England, members of a farming family suspect the oldest daughter of witchcraft when the youngest son suddenly vanishes.

programme.title: The Square
programme.desc: Disaster strikes when a curator hires a public relations team to build some buzz for his renowned Swedish museum.

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2
programme.desc: Clouseau (Steve Martin) and a team of international detectives investigate the thefts of the world's greatest treasures, including the diamond called the Pink Panther.

programme.title: The Pink Panther 2
programme.desc: Clouseau (Steve Martin) and a team of international detectives investigate the thefts of the world's greatest treasures, including the diamond called the Pink Panther.

programme.title: The Last Word
programme.desc: A once-successful businesswoman (Shirley MacLaine) develops a strong bond with the young local writer (Amanda Seyfried) who's penning her life story.

programme.title: Gemini
programme.desc: A heinous crime tests the complex relationship between a Hollywood starlet and her tenacious personal assistant. As the assistant unravels the mystery, she must confront her own understanding of friendship, truth and celebrity.

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: A man (Keegan-Michael Key) and his cousin (Jordan Peele) pose as ruthless gangsters to recover a stolen kitten.

programme.title: Victor Frankenstein
programme.desc: When the experiments of radical scientist Victor Frankenstein (James McAvoy) go too far, only Igor Strausman (Daniel Radcliffe), his equally brilliant protg, can bring him back from the brink of madness and save him from his monstrous creation.

programme.title: The Captive
programme.desc: Eight years after a child disappeared without a trace, detectives find disturbing clues that indicate that the girl is still alive.

programme.title: Body of Lies
programme.desc: A CIA operative (Leonardo DiCaprio) hatches a dangerous plan to catch the leader of a terrorist organization, but conflicts with his two closest allies (Russell Crowe, Mark Strong) may cost him his life.

programme.title: Ronin
programme.desc: An Irish ringleader (Natascha McElhone) organizes an international team of hired guns (Robert De Niro, Jean Reno) to retrieve a briefcase from criminals.

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
programme.desc: While a man (Jack Black) is on assignment in the Bermuda Triangle, a vortex transports him to Lilliput, a magic land of little people.

programme.title: Spaceballs
programme.desc: President Skroob (Mel Brooks) pits evil Dark Helmet (Rick Moranis) against Lone Starr and the half-man, half-dog Barf (John Candy).

programme.title: Over Her Dead Body
programme.desc: A jealous ghost (Eva Longoria Parker), who died on her wedding day, tries to sabotage her groom's (Paul Rudd) new romance with a psychic (Lake Bell).

programme.title: Tusk
programme.desc: A U.S. podcaster (Justin Long) ventures into the Canadian wilderness to interview an old man (Michael Parks) who has an extraordinary past, and the American learns the man has a dark secret involving a walrus.

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: A billionaire (Pierce Brosnan) looking for new challenges attracts the attention of an investigator (Rene Russo) when a priceless Monet is stolen.

programme.title: The Return of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bungling Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) once again seeks the Pink Panther diamond and maddens his boss (Herbert Lom).

programme.title: The Return of the Pink Panther
programme.desc: Bungling Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) once again seeks the Pink Panther diamond and maddens his boss (Herbert Lom).

programme.title: Conviction

programme.title: Dark Places
programme.desc: A woman (Charlize Theron) confronts traumatic, childhood memories of the murder of her mother and two sisters when she investigates the possibility that her brother (Corey Stoll) is innocent of the crime.

programme.title: Doomsday
programme.desc: A commander (Rhona Mitra) and her crew venture into long-quarantined Scotland to find the counteragent to a deadly virus that has re-emerged in London.

programme.title: Just Wright

programme.desc: Writer and journalist David Lipsky (Jesse Eisenberg) interviews author David Foster Wallace (Jason Segel) for Rolling Stone magazine.

programme.title: Out of Time
programme.desc: Considered a suspect in a deadly arson, a police chief (Denzel Washington) must cover his tracks while trying to prove his innocence.

programme.desc: The prison-bound manager (Will Ferrell) of a hedge fund asks a black businessman (Kevin Hart) -- who has never been to jail -- to prepare him for life behind bars.

programme.title: Kingpin
programme.desc: A one-handed salesman (Woody Harrelson), an Amish farm boy (Randy Quaid) and a pretty con artist (Vanessa Angel) pull bowling scams to get to a $1 million tournament in Reno.

programme.title: White Men Can't Jump
programme.desc: Two basketball hustlers (Wesley Snipes, Woody Harrelson), black and white, count on racial myth to cash in on street games.

programme.title: Green Room
programme.desc: Members (Anton Yelchin, Alia Shawkat) of a punk-rock band and a tough young woman (Imogen Poots) battle murderous white supremacists at a remote Oregon roadhouse.

programme.desc: A vampire hunter (Jason Scott Lee) goes in search of medical students who hope to distill the key to immortality from the body of Dracula.

programme.desc: With help from his partner (Jason Scott Lee), a vampire hunter (Jason London) tries to save his fiancee from the evil count in Romania.

programme.title: Wild Rose
programme.desc: Fresh out of prison, a Scottish woman juggles her job and two children while pursuing her dream of becoming a country music star. She soon gets her chance when she travels to Nashville, Tenn., on a life-changing journey to discover her true voice.

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding
programme.desc: Family tensions arise after a woman (Nia Vardalos) falls in love with a man (John Corbett) who is not Greek.

programme.title: Pens & Pencils
programme.desc: A high school teacher embarks on a wild-goose chase to find a missing student that no one else seems to miss.

programme.title: Extortion
programme.desc: A family stranded on an island in the Bahamas believe it is being rescued by two fishermen but come to realize it is being held hostage until it hands over $1 million.

programme.title: Get Hard
programme.desc: The prison-bound manager (Will Ferrell) of a hedge fund asks a black businessman (Kevin Hart) -- who has never been to jail -- to prepare him for life behind bars.

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Following in his father's (Chevy Chase) footsteps, Rusty Griswold (Ed Helms) takes his wife (Christina Applegate) and two sons on a cross-country road trip to America's favorite fun park, Walley World.

programme.title: The Last Stand
programme.desc: A sheriff (Arnold Schwarzenegger) must take matters into his own hands when a notorious drug lord escapes from FBI custody and comes speeding toward a showdown in the lawman's quiet border town.

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: On planet LV-426, Ripley (Sigourney Weaver) and a dwindling number of Marines battle an almost-unstoppable army of monstrous predators which wiped out an entire colony of humans, save for one little girl (Carrie Henn).

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Hired to tame a rowdy Missouri bar, a Ph.D. bouncer (Patrick Swayze) romances a doctor (Kelly Lynch) and tames the whole town.

programme.title: Insidious: Chapter 3
programme.desc: Psychic Elise Rainier (Lin Shaye) reluctantly agrees to use her ability to converse with the dead to help a teenage girl (Stefanie Scott) who is being tormented by a dangerous supernatural entity.

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: After a sideshow vampire (John C. Reilly) turns a teenager into one of the undead, the kid becomes a pawn between warring supernatural factions.

programme.title: Silent House
programme.desc: Horrifying events turn panic to real terror when a young woman (Elizabeth Olsen) becomes trapped in the old house she's helping her father and uncle renovate.

programme.title: Slice
programme.desc: In a spooky small town, when a slew of pizza delivery boys are slain on the job, two daring survivors set out to catch the culprits behind the cryptic crime spree.

programme.title: Lean on Pete
programme.desc: Charley, a teen living with his single father, finds work caring for an aging racehorse named Lean on Pete. When he learns Pete is bound for slaughter, the two embark on an odyssey across the new American frontier in search of a place to call home.

programme.title: The B-Side: Elsa Dorfman's Portrait Photography
programme.desc: A profile of celebrated portrait photographer Elsa Dorfman, whose friends and subjects include Allen Ginsberg and Bob Dylan.

programme.title: Amazing Grace
programme.desc: Singer Aretha Franklin performs gospel songs at the New Temple Missionary Baptist Church in Los Angeles in 1972.

programme.title: Amazing Grace
programme.desc: Singer Aretha Franklin performs gospel songs at the New Temple Missionary Baptist Church in Los Angeles in 1972.

programme.title: Pure
programme.desc: An insecure girl grapples with fears of embracing her sexuality.

programme.title: Shiva Baby
programme.desc: While at a Jewish funeral service with her parents, a college student has an awkward encounter with her sugar daddy and her ex-girlfriend.

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A college freshman (Lola Kirke) cures her disappointment and loneliness by allowing herself to be pulled into the wacky schemes of her future stepsister (Greta Gerwig).

programme.title: She's Out of My League
programme.desc: An airport security agent (Jay Baruchel) must figure out how to make the relationship work when a beautiful, successful woman (Alice Eve) falls in love with him.

programme.title: Cyrus
programme.desc: A downtrodden divorced man (John C. Reilly) becomes locked in a battle of wills with his new lover's possessive son (Jonah Hill).

programme.title: Backstabbing for Beginners
programme.desc: Based on a true story, an idealistic young employee at the U.N. investigates the grizzly murder of his predecessor -- uncovering a vast global conspiracy that may involve his own boss.

programme.title: Hellboy II: The Golden Army
programme.desc: Hellboy (Ron Perlman) and his team face an underworld prince who plans to awaken a lethal army and use it to reclaim Earth for his magical kindred.

programme.title: The Other Side of the Door
programme.desc: A grieving mother (Sarah Wayne Callies) upsets the balance between life and death when she opens an ancient door that releases the restless spirit of her deceased son (Logan Creran).

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: A couple (James Brolin, Margot Kidder) battle a demonic presence in their new home, the location of many gruesome murders a year earlier.

programme.title: Walking Tall
programme.desc: A former Special Forces soldier (The Rock) becomes sheriff and deputizes an old friend (Johnny Knoxville) to help rid their town of thugs.

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: FBI agents Bobby (Jeremy Ray Valdez) and Julian (Will Rothhaar) infiltrate a drug cartel run by Jason (Walter Perez) and Derek (Joseph Julian Soria), their childhood friends.

programme.title: XXX
programme.desc: A government agent (Samuel L. Jackson) recruits an athlete (Vin Diesel) to stop an anarchist from using biological and chemical weapons.

programme.title: The Rover
programme.desc: After thieves steal his car, a hardened loner (Guy Pearce) forces a wounded member (Robert Pattinson) of their gang to help him track them down across a scorched and perilous landscape.

programme.title: Cujo
programme.desc: Bitten by a rabid bat, a huge dog traps a Maine woman (Dee Wallace) and her young son (Danny Pintauro) in their Ford Pinto.

programme.title: Pawn Sacrifice
programme.desc: American chess legend Bobby Fischer (Tobey Maguire) and Soviet Grandmaster Boris Spassky (Liev Schreiber) enthrall the world with their intense battle of wills and strategy during the 1972 World Chess Championship.

programme.title: Ginger & Rosa
programme.desc: In 1962 London, the lifelong friendship between two teenagers (Elle Fanning, Alice Englert) dissolves after one seduces the other's father.

programme.title: The Upside of Anger
programme.desc: An ex-ballplayer (Kevin Costner) befriends a mother (Joan Allen) of four who has hovered in a boozy funk since her husband abandoned her.

programme.title: Jersey Boys

programme.title: The Second Best Exotic Marigold Hotel
programme.desc: While Sonny sets his eye on a second property, new arrivals, a lack of space and the demands of a traditional Indian wedding threaten to engulf Evelyn, Douglas, Muriel and the others.

programme.title: Woman Walks Ahead
programme.desc: A headstrong New York painter embarks on a dangerous journey to meet Sitting Bull but must face off with an Army officer intent on war with the Native Americans.

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.desc: After losing most of his hearing in the Vietnam War, Richard Pimentel (Ron Livingston) becomes a motivational speaker and a driving force behind the Americans With Disabilities Act.

programme.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
programme.desc: Worlds collide when Enn, a shy teenager in 1970s London, meets the beautiful and rebellious Zan at a party. They set in motion the ultimate showdown between their rivaling worlds and test the limits of how far they will go for true love.

programme.title: The Weekend
programme.desc: A down-on-her-luck comedian's vacation plans are interrupted by her ex-boyfriend and his new girlfriend.

programme.title: Cyrus
programme.desc: A downtrodden divorced man (John C. Reilly) becomes locked in a battle of wills with his new lover's possessive son (Jonah Hill).

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: In 1988, N.W.A (O'Shea Jackson Jr., Corey Hawkins, Jason Mitchell) revolutionizes music and pop culture with their brutally honest depiction of life in Southern Los Angeles.

programme.title: Pathology
programme.desc: A medical intern (Milo Ventimiglia) discovers his colleagues are playing a deadly game in which one commits the perfect murder, then the others compete to find the cause of death.

programme.title: You're Next
programme.desc: Members of an estranged, upper-class family must pull together to repel home invaders who are disguised in animal masks and trying to kill them.

programme.title: The Foot Fist Way
programme.desc: After discovering his wife's infidelity, a bombastic but hopelessly inept martial artist (Danny R. McBride) sets out on a quest to meet his idol (Ben Best).

programme.title: Posse: The Revenge of Jessie Lee
programme.desc: Spanish-American War deserters (Mario Van Peebles, Stephen Baldwin, Charles Lane) wind up defending a black township from a sheriff and his henchmen.

programme.title: The Amityville Horror
programme.desc: A couple (James Brolin, Margot Kidder) battle a demonic presence in their new home, the location of many gruesome murders a year earlier.

programme.title: Equals
programme.desc: Nia (Kristen Stewart) and Silas (Nicholas Hoult) begin a forbidden and passionate romance in a futuristic society where emotions have been outlawed, leading them to attempt a dangerous escape.

programme.title: Equals
programme.desc: Nia (Kristen Stewart) and Silas (Nicholas Hoult) begin a forbidden and passionate romance in a futuristic society where emotions have been outlawed, leading them to attempt a dangerous escape.

programme.title: Cirque du Freak: The Vampire's Assistant
programme.desc: After a sideshow vampire (John C. Reilly) turns a teenager into one of the undead, the kid becomes a pawn between warring supernatural factions.

programme.title: Movie
programme.desc: Movie to be announced.

programme.title: Ordinary People
programme.desc: A suburban Chicago couple (Donald Sutherland, Mary Tyler Moore) and their son (Timothy Hutton) are torn apart by another son's death.

programme.title: The Company You Keep
programme.desc: After a reporter (Shia LaBeouf) uncovers his real identity, a former Weather Underground activist (Robert Redford) goes on the run to track down his former lover (Julie Christie), a fellow member of his cell who never gave up the fight.

programme.title: Room
programme.desc: Held captive for years in an enclosed space, a woman (Brie Larson) and her young son (Jacob Tremblay) finally gain their freedom, allowing the boy to experience the outside world for the first time.

programme.title: Pulling Strings
programme.desc: Rachel, a diplomatic consul, passes out on a street in Mexico City after a night of drinking. She is rescued by Alejandro, a single father whose visa she rejected the day before, and sparks fly between the two.

programme.title: The Upside of Anger
programme.desc: An ex-ballplayer (Kevin Costner) befriends a mother (Joan Allen) of four who has hovered in a boozy funk since her husband abandoned her.

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business
programme.desc: The owner (Ice Cube) of a barbershop faces pressure from a corporation that is opening establishments in his neighborhood.

programme.title: Beauty Shop
programme.desc: A determined hairstylist (Queen Latifah) competes with her former boss after opening her own business in Atlanta.

programme.title: Dim Sum Funeral
programme.desc: The grown children of an overbearing Chinese matriarch reluctantly gather to take part in seven days' worth of traditional funeral rites.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: When members of a dance troupe are lured to an empty school, drug-laced sangria causes their jubilant rehearsal to descend into a dark and explosive nightmare as they try to survive the night -- and find out who's responsible -- before it's too late.

programme.title: Children of the Corn IV: The Gathering
programme.desc: A medical student (Naomi Watts) tries to free children in a Nebraska town from an evil figure's influence.

programme.title: Children of the Corn V: Fields of Terror
programme.desc: Determined to save her estranged brother from a suicide cult, a young woman faces murderous children and worse.

programme.title: The Rider
programme.desc: After a riding accident leaves him unable to compete on the rodeo circuit, a young cowboy searches for a new purpose.

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: Tracy faces no competition in her high school election, but the civics teacher intervenes by encouraging the varsity football player to run for president, resulting in chaos.

programme.title: Another Country
programme.desc: An interracial couple try to raise their child during the racially polarizing times of 1956 Mississippi.

programme.title: Philomena
programme.desc: Journalist Martin Sixsmith (Steve Coogan) helps Philomena Lee (Judi Dench) search for her long-lost son, who was taken from her by nuns in an Irish convent and sold into adoption when she was an unwed teenager.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: A troubled Gulf War veteran (Denzel Washington) becomes suspicious after a powerful senator's (Meryl Streep) son (Liev Schreiber) becomes a candidate for vice president.

programme.title: Extortion
programme.desc: A family stranded on an island in the Bahamas believe it is being rescued by two fishermen but come to realize it is being held hostage until it hands over $1 million.

programme.title: Mistress America
programme.desc: A college freshman (Lola Kirke) cures her disappointment and loneliness by allowing herself to be pulled into the wacky schemes of her future stepsister (Greta Gerwig).

programme.title: Laggies
programme.desc: Caught in a panic over her boyfriend's marriage proposal, Megan pretends to go on a business trip but, in reality, hangs out with a teenage friend, Annika.

programme.title: Baby Mama
programme.desc: A battle of wills breaks out when a working-class woman (Amy Poehler) moves in with the high-powered executive (Tina Fey) who hired her to be a surrogate mother.

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Chili Palmer (John Travolta) runs afoul of music-industry players when he teams up with a friend's widow (Uma Thurman) to produce a singer's debut album.

programme.title: Obvious Child
programme.desc: An immature, newly unemployed comic (Jenny Slate) must navigate the murky waters of adulthood after her fling with a graduate student (Jake Lacy) results in an unplanned pregnancy.

programme.title: Keanu
programme.desc: A man (Keegan-Michael Key) and his cousin (Jordan Peele) pose as ruthless gangsters to recover a stolen kitten.

programme.title: Braddock: Missing in Action III
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) returns to Vietnam and fights his way out with his wife, son (Roland Harrah III) and Amerasian orphans.

programme.title: Amy
programme.desc: Archival footage and personal testimonials present an intimate portrait of the life and career of British singer/songwriter Amy Winehouse.

programme.title: The Adderall Diaries
programme.desc: Suffering from writer's block, author Stephen Elliott (James Franco) reconnects with his estranged father (Ed Harris) while investigating the murder case of computer entrepreneur Hans Reiser (Christian Slater).

programme.title: Road House
programme.desc: Hired to tame a rowdy Missouri bar, a Ph.D. bouncer (Patrick Swayze) romances a doctor (Kelly Lynch) and tames the whole town.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Henry and the other kids destroy Ray's prized movie prop, The Theranos Boot; to replace it, Henry and Jasper travel to an alternate universe Man Cave using Bill Evil's interdimensional transporter and steal their Theranos Boot before Ray finds out.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Captain Man and Kid Danger guard Swellview's newest attraction, the EnvyGram Wall; when Captain Man destroys the wall while trying to eliminate a small bird, Kid Danger and Captain Man have to figure out a way to replace it.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: When Piper's school parrot, Otto, starts to repeat that Henry is Kid Danger, Henry and Jasper have to stall until Ray, Charlotte and Schwoz can find a way to fix things.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Captain Man and Kid Danger need a little bit of magic and some help from an old friend in order to catch a thief.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: While trying to celebrate his birthday, Henry keeps getting interrupted by crimes going on in Swellview.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Jasper gets the chance to take his crush to Cactus Con, but when a mysterious villain gets involved in the convention, the entire gang is forced into action.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: The gang thinks its has found the perfect tunnels to access all of Swellview, until it is confronted by the tunnels' original inhabitants.

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Henry and the gang set up a secret underground restaurant in the Man Cave for Charlotte's private dinner with music superstar Jack Swagger; when word gets out that Jack Swagger is in town, some unwanted guests crash the party.

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.title: Henry Danger

programme.title: Henry Danger
programme.desc: Henry and Charlotte discover things are not what they seem when Captain Man suddenly announces his plans to marry.

programme.desc: When Clawdeen begins attending Monster High, she discovers a devious plot that would not only destroy her school, but it would also reveal her half-human, half-werewolf identity.

programme.desc: Paper gives Rock mechanical eyebrows to help with an audition; Scissors has an adventure with stand-ins.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: When Stella's music box disappears at school, the gang immediately suspects a student urban legend known as the Rat Beast; after a night of zombie movies, Clyde and Lincoln find an empty Loud house and assume it's a zombie apocalypse.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lola struggles to dampen her sweet tooth when mom challenges her to go an entire week without added sugar; Lincoln strives to impress the Amazing Brailster when he's chosen to be his assistant at the Illusion Chateau.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: All of Lincoln's sisters develop a crush on his new tutor, making it impossible for Lincoln to study; the children complain about their house, but they start to feel differently after a tornado threatens to destroy it.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: When a sinkhole opens up at school, Lincoln and his classmates are forced to share lockers; when Lana brings home a skunk to rehabilitate, Lola grows attached when she finds the skunk has finer tastes.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Mom tries to convince a newspaper editor that her kids are perfect in order to land a parenting advice column job; Luna is hired to watch the McBrides' cat when they go out of town, but the job becomes more demanding than she imagined.

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Lynn finds an unexpected TV sports-watching buddy in the family's next-door neighbor, Mr. Grouse; when Lisa realizes that Pop Pop won't be around forever, she turns to science to ensure his longevity.

programme.desc: Lori banishes a ghost she believes is haunting her, but when Fairway's golf team starts to struggle, she realizes she needs to bring it back to turn the team's luck around.

programme.title: The Loud House

programme.title: The Loud House

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: All ten of Lincoln's sisters want to use the new kiddie pool he has purchased, but it is not large enough for all of them; after noticing that none of his sisters share his interests, Lincoln tries to mold Lily into his mini-me.

programme.title: The Loud House

programme.title: The Loud House
